org.apache.juneau.plaintext

Class PlainTextSerializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.CoreObject
      • org.apache.juneau.serializer.Serializer
        • org.apache.juneau.serializer.WriterSerializer
          • org.apache.juneau.plaintext.PlainTextSerializer

  • public class PlainTextSerializer
extends WriterSerializer
    Serializes POJOs to plain text using just the toString() method on the serialized object.
    Media types:
    Handles Accept types: text/plain

    Produces Content-Type types: text/plain

    Description:
    Essentially converts POJOs to plain text using the toString() method.

    Also serializes objects using a transform if the object class has an PojoSwap<?,String> transform defined on it.

    Configurable properties:
    This class has the following properties associated with it:
    • SerializerContext
    • BeanContext

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlainTextSerializer

        public PlainTextSerializer(PropertyStore propertyStore)

        propertyStore - The property store containing all the settings for this object.

      • PlainTextSerializer

        public PlainTextSerializer(PropertyStore propertyStore,
                           String produces,
                           String... accept)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        propertyStore - The property store containing all the settings for this object.
        produces - The media type that this serializer produces.
        accept - The accept media types that the serializer can handle.

        Can contain meta-characters per the media-type specification of RFC2616/14.1

        If empty, then assumes the only media type supported is produces.

        For example, if this serializer produces "application/json" but should handle media types of "application/json" and "text/json", then the arguments should be:
        super(propertyStore, "application/json", "application/json", "text/json");
        ...or...
        super(propertyStore, "application/json", "*​/json");

      • createSession

        public WriterSerializerSession createSession(SerializerSessionArgs args)
        Description copied from class: Serializer
        Create the session object used for actual serialization of objects.
        Specified by:
        createSession in class WriterSerializer
        Parameters:
        args - Runtime arguments. These specify session-level information such as locale and URI context. It also include session-level properties that override the properties defined on the bean and serializer contexts.
        Returns:
        The new session object.
        Note that you must call BeanSession.close() on this object to perform any necessary cleanup.
